message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this unique opportunity to purchase a high-value product. I believe you'll find it to be a valuable addition to your collection. I'm willing to offer it to you for $2000000.

Alice, your offer is significantly higher than my budget. I'm interested in the product, but I'm only willing to pay $1000000. This is my final offer, and I'm ready to walk away if it's not acceptable.

I understand that $1000000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1500000, which is the minimum I'm willing to accept. This is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower.

Alice, while I appreciate your willingness to compromise, $1500000 is still outside of my budget. I'm willing to go up to $1250000, but that's my absolute limit. If this isn't acceptable, I'm prepared to move on to another option.

I'm willing to meet you at $1250000, but I'm not willing to go any lower than that. However, I'm willing to throw in some extras to sweeten the deal. I'll include a 2-year warranty and a comprehensive maintenance package, which normally costs $50000. This way, you'll get the product, warranty, and maintenance package for $1250000. This is my final offer.
